body:
Hi Theodore,



Yes, it is possible in HB[+]. We take the three channel (RGB) irradiance results and convert it into illuminance ([example](https://github.com/ladybug-tools/honeybee/blob/master/scripts/TwoPhaseIllum.py#L80-L86)) as per the [Photopic curve](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Photopic_vision). So, if we were to not combine the results, we'll end up with RGB values.

However, as I mentioned before, CIE skies and Perez skies are geared towards brightness and not spectral calculations. So, such a simulation is unlikely to be physically relevant. A case in point is during twilight, when daylight has a warmer hue. The spectral nature of this sun and sky is not captured in daylighting simulations.
